talk.author: did:plc:24lz3lshhmjsieafxih4exlw
talk.utter:
I love fandom discourse when people pick the worst, grossest, most evil character and are like "actually i love him and I could fix him."

which is why I like to say it about Mr. Teatime. but everyone who knows who he is knows me too well to take the bait.

talk.utter:
the film adaptation teatime or the book?

i haven’t read the book but i do kinda like the film guy. i do have a thing for the skeeziest guys

talk.author: did:plc:24lz3lshhmjsieafxih4exlw
talk.utter: they're pretty much the same, although in the book his fake eye is white instead of black.

talk.author: did:plc:24lz3lshhmjsieafxih4exlw
talk.utter: Supernatural did it well, plus I personally found the overarching heaven and hell theme a bit more interesting than the aliens even though it was equally incoherent

talk.author: did:plc:2z7d44mic3e4vl4upiy4kj5h
talk.utter: Supernatural is my favorite show of all time, even when it's (frequently) terrible. It's why almost every book I read is some flavor of Urban Fantasy. Love me a Monster of the Week story.
